CARDINAL . In DATE the applicants brought actions against ORG and the local department of ORG of GPE before ORG , seeking compensation for non - pecuniary damage . In support of their claims they relied on the findings in the judgment , the special ruling of DATE and the internal investigation report of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court rejected the ORG claims . In so doing the court reasoned as follows :

“ ... According to the legislation in force , redress for non - pecuniary damage has to be made by the person who has caused it by his own malicious acts . A finding of guilt and a link of causality between the impugned acts and the damage are the necessary conditions for liability . ”

“ The PERSON argument that negligent acts and omissions by the administration of ORG brought about the detrimental consequences in issue and caused non - pecuniary damage to the claimants can not be accepted as no causal link between the acts and omissions of ORG and the consequences in question was established by the internal investigation .
According to section CARDINAL of LAW , an organisation has to pay compensation for damage caused by its employees in the course of their employment .

It was established in the course of the criminal proceedings that [ NORP ] , being the deputy head of the criminal investigation department at FAC , had committed the crimes while off duty and for purely violent motives .
In the light of the foregoing , the court has reached the conclusion that the claims should be rejected . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the ORG and ORG of GPE respectively rejected appeals by the applicants .
